oai_dc:dc.dc:title: French. Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 23 d.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 23 d. Newspaper clipping: Chattanooga suffragists have not appointed delegates...
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Politics & government; Clippings; Scrapbooks; Women; Women's suffrage;
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: C.M. McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814. Please provide a brief description of the material.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: CHATTANOOGA suffragists have not appointed delegates to the state convention at Knoxville, Oct. 28-30, but it was said yesterday that this matter would likely come up at the next meeting of the local league. This year Nashville will send twenty delegates to the state meeting and the trip will be made in a special coach decorated with the suffrage colors. At each station "votes for women" literature will be distributed. Memphis will also send a big delegation. Last year Nashville, Memphis and Chattanooga each had ten representatives at the meeting and the increased number of delegates from the capital city is evidence of the rapid growth of that body. Mrs. L. Crozier French has announced that a number of prominent suffragists will appear on the program, among them being Miss Alice Paul. Mrs. Medill McCormick. Miss Kate Gordon and others of equal note. The social features of the state convention are numerous and the plans include several big affairs including a public reception at the Hotel Imperial, where the delegates will be entertained by the Knoxville league. The league at Franklin will be the baby association of the state at the convention. This league was organized last week by Mrs. Guilford Dudley, president of the Nashville forces.
